summary: You Can Never Be Mine | Chapter 9 “Jon. What I said a moment ago...I didn’t mean…” She faltered, still unsure what she’d said or...
body:
You Can Never Be Mine | Chapter 9

“Jon. What I said a moment ago…I didn’t mean…” She faltered, still unsure what she’d said or done to aggrieve him.

But he shook his head, coming back to the moment. “No. I know. But you’re right. There’s something we need to talk about.”

“About…Nymeria?” she guessed, a slick slide of fear down her back making the hairs on her arms stand.

“No.” He hesitated. “Maybe. Yes. She’s part of it.” A harried breath sawed through his teeth as he hunched forward, elbows braced on his thighs. Carefully, Dany set the dagger on the table.

“All right,” she whispered, bracing herself, but Jon stalled, dropping his face into his hands. As the silence stretched on longer, she grew agitated.

When he finally lifted his head, she held her breath. “Gods, Dany. I don’t know how to tell you—where to start—”

“Just say it, Jon,” she snapped, reaching the frayed end of her patience. “It can’t be any worse than anything else I’ve heard lately.”

He winced, then crooked his head toward her so his eyes met hers, this time without the aid of the looking glass. “Dany.” He swallowed a couple times before he forced the words out. “I’m not a Stark. Or a Snow, for that matter. Ned isn’t my father. He was never my father.”

Read it on AO3. There’s smut, finally, in case you were holding out just for this moment. Happy New Year, fam!

summary: COMING SOON! Where you are, I will be: A Jonsa & Robbcella Apocalypse AU  A sneak peak below the break... [[MORE]] Prologue: In...
caption:
COMING SOON!

Where you are, I will be: A Jonsa & Robbcella Apocalypse AU 

A sneak peak below the break…


Prologue:

In the latter part of the last century, scientists discovered that the Bubonic Plague, commonly referred to as the Black Death, could be cured by antibiotics. This made those practicing modern medicine feel a certain superiority over the millions who died in misery centuries prior, and more dangerous still, gave them the assurance that they would never in their lifetime see such an epidemic. 

If anyone had listened more fully to a wise man’s theory of evolution, they would have perhaps not felt quite so certain. For they would have realised that all of evolution is a matter of survival, and therefore as the prey adapts so must the predator. 

The Valyrian Flu, commonly referred to as the Dragon’s Curse for the feeling of burning from within that was the final stage before death, swept through the world at an alarming rate. Within the first two days it was suggested, back when things like this were still conjectured about on the morning news, that a tenth of the population had perished. A week later, when half of it was gone, there was no one left to report on such a thing. 

The people of the modern world found themselves suddenly in similar circumstances to those who fought against the Black Death. There were no cell phones, no internet, electricity and clean water were soon in short supply. Like their counterparts centuries before some turned towards prayer, others to farfetched ideas of how to ward off the illness, while some merely relished in the lawlessness that always accompanied times of chaos. 

Others still embarked on journeys to reunite with loved ones so that they might survive and rebuild, or failing that, perish together. 

It was often thought in the years following an occurrence of the Black Death that the souls of the recently departed remained on the same plane as the living, as though there were simply too many for heaven and hell to split between them and so some were ultimately doomed to a second life on earth forever waiting for absolution or damnation. 

There was no way of proving such a thing, of course, but it is worth mentioning now so that you know. So that I’ve prepared you. Just because I am the one telling this story does not mean that I’ve survived, but if you are reading this it means that someone did, and that, dear reader, is hope enough.

summary: “That’s pretty.” He remembered Sansa telling him once that he should say that whenever a lady told him her name.  --A Clash of...
body:
“That’s pretty.” He remembered Sansa telling him once that he should say that whenever a lady told him her name. 

–A Clash of Kings

“Sansa, what do girls like?”

Sansa paused in her sewing to look at Jon Snow. “What do you mean?”

Flushing, Jon tried to keep himself from stuttering. “I mean, if I… if I want to talk to a girl, what should I do?”

A look of delight lit up Sansa’s eyes. “You like someone!” She leaned closer and asked in a conspiratorial whisper, “Who is it? I promise I won’t tell.“

Jon’s face burned and he was sure he was turning as red as Sansa’s hair. "I-I don’t know her name yet.”

“Oh. Then you should ask for her name first.”

Jon nodded, waiting for her to continue.

“And when a lady gives you her name, you must tell her how pretty it is,” she said sagely.

Jon furrowed his brows, taking in her words. “Do girls like that?”

“Yes we do. I know I would like it if someone said something like that to me.

“Well,” said Jon quietly, without thinking.“ You do have a very pretty name.”

The radiant smile that Sansa gave him then made the lesson stick to Jon more than anything else.

summary: Just a reminder to Game of Thrones fans, the main hero doesn’t need to be a stupid for him to be good.  Jon can be a good man as...
body: Just a reminder to Game of Thrones fans, the main hero doesn’t need to be a stupid for him to be good.  Jon can be a good man as well as a good ruler, a good politician and a good general.  Oh and he didn’t need to kneel to Daenerys like some sort of common servant at all.  I will never be okay with the supposed hero degrading himself into a pet mistress at the docile command of Kween Daenerys.

summary: If Jon had joined stannis  would he have to join rhollism too ? Stannis and melisandre should know it would enrage the north...
question: If Jon had joined stannis  would he have to join rhollism too ? Stannis and melisandre should know it would enrage the north men. Enjoy holidays !!
answer:
Yes.

Lord Snow. Ser Alliser Thorne had named him that, to mock his bastard birth. Many of his brothers had taken to using it as well, some with affection, others to wound. But suddenly it had a different sound to it in Jon’s ears. It sounded…real. “Yes,” he said, hesitantly, “kings have legitimized bastards before, but…I am still a brother of the Night’s Watch. I knelt before a heart tree and swore to hold no lands and father no children.”

“Jon.” Melisandre was so close he could feel the warmth of her breath. “R'hllor is the only true god. A vow sworn to a tree has no more power than one sworn to your shoes. Open your heart and let the light of the Lord come in. Burn these weirwoods, and accept Winterfell as a gift of the Lord of Light.”

- Jon XI, ASoS

Jon can’t just up and join Stannis. That would be desertion of the Night’s Watch and serious oathbreaking. Nor can Stannis release Jon as Robb planned to. Robb was the established ruler of the North, planning to release his sole known surviving brother and sole known free sibling to be his heir, a controversial move but explicable in the light of the succession politics and the bonds of blood and affection between the brothers. Stannis is not accepted as ruler of the North, and his releasing Jon from his vows would be looked at a bit more sceptically. Kind of like Stannis is just looking for a Stark name to shove in Winterfell and doesn’t care about the norms he has to trample to get there.

The solution is R’hllor. Melisandre’s saying here that if Jon should convert, any vows he swore in R’hllor’s name would override vows sworn by the old gods (because R’hllor is real and the old gods are not). He would therefore be clear to join Stannis’ cause.

This might not be a line of reasoning that would be warmly regarded by other Northerners, particularly if it came with burning Winterfell’s godswood, but Stannis doesn’t need Jon to be popular - just more popular than the Freys and the Boltons.

summary: The reunion (Jon snow)
body:
The reunion (Jon snow)

This was in my drafts somewhere XD

Word count: 1693

Warnings : Ramsay being Ramsay, angst and war themes

Rating : mostly fluff at the end, angst, also SPOILERS for S6

This morning seemed to be colder than usual. Y/N shivered as she filled a bucket with icy water and turned back to the castle. Winterfell looked so different than she remembered it: The majestic walls and the once splendid looking towers Bran used to climb were now darkened due to the enormous fires that were lit at all times to burn the meat of animals and men. Yes, Winterfell had indeed changed. But she tried not to think about those times often, it made her too sad. Luckily, she had been up early today. This way she escaped some of the sexually suggestive comments by the wards that were to guard the prisoners. Y/N pitied them. Living with Ramsay when he was happy was already horrific, she didn’t dare to picture him when in a bad mood. She hurried inside and brushed the snow off her boots. At least, it was a bit warmer than outside, she thought bitterly. She observed the hall carefully after pouring the water into another bucket that stood by the door. She spotted Reek on the other side of the hall and quickly went over to him. Usually he was nice to her, because he was afraid that he’d displease Ramsay if he didn’t. “G-Good morning, m'lady”, he stuttered and stopped lighting candles. Y/N gave him a reassuring smile and said :“Do you know where Rickon is?"Reek quickly shook his head, looking as nervous as ever. Y/N suppressed a sigh and nodded, turning to the nearest staircase. In her chamber, she couldn’t help but cry a bit. She went to her window and looked outside : A snow storm was rising and brought back her memories. She missed Osha. And Arya and Sansa and Bran and Robb and Jon. Especially Jon. She grew up in a village near Winterfell and worked in the bakery of her parents. Because of Sansas addiction to lemon cakes she had been in the castle quite often. That’s how she had met Jon, as well. When she first had laid her eyes on him, she had fallen for him. After a while, they started to spend more time together and something like love had developed since Jon and Y/N shared their first kiss in the stables. But he had grown more reserved and when Y/N learned that he was taking the black because of his heritage, she was furious. He was too honorable,but she would have given everything to see him again. After Robb had died and the Boltons took over Winterfell, nothing was like before. Y/N had been able to escape, earning her money by working in brothels and finally joined the duo after hearing that they were heading north. Unfortunately, they got caught and were now in the grasp of Ramsay. Y/N wasn’t allowed to leave the castle grounds and she had to be his "wife” (aka his whore). She was aware that at the tiniest mistake, he’d have her head. Sighing, she turned from the window and the swirling snowflakes and decided to try and sleep for a bit. But when she moved towards her small, hard bed, she noticed a piece of paper, lying on the matress. With shaky hands she picked it up. ‘Dearest wife, please forgive me’…? Before she could comprehend the words , a calloused hand clamped over her mouth and pulled her into complete darkness. “You don’t want to make any sound right now, trust me ”, was whispered into her ear before the world went pitch black.

When she awoke, she felt worn out and thirsty. As the memories came flooding back, so did the panic. She tried to move, but she was bound to a -horse? She couldn’t see either, because a tie on her eyes made everything a dark grey. She tried to calm herself. She wouldn’t be hurt. She thought about Jon and eventually fell asleep after a while. When she woke up again, the tie had been lifted from her eyes and she saw that she was indeed sitting on a brown horse one of a hundred horses with soldiers upon them. Nervously, her eyes flew over a great, muddy field. Then she looked to the right and her heart stopped. With a sadistic grin plastered on his lips, Ramsay watched her intensely. “My wife! ”, he exclaimed softly and with an excited spark in his eyes. “I apologize for your uncomfortable transport. Sadly, it was the only way to be sure you won’t try something.. Naughty. And you know what happens with naughty girls, don’t you?” Y/N squeezed her eyes shut as images of skinned and crippled women invaded her mind.“ I do know that you would like to escape, rather than staying here with me. That.. disappoints me, pet”, he whispered gently into her ear. She shuddered involuntarily. He leaned back. “We’ll talk about that later. Now, I’ve brought you to enjoy the show. A certain bastard of Ned Stark is coming to reclaim his father’s castle and his brother - and I wonder if he even is familiar with you?” He winked at her. He couldn’t be talking about Jon, could he? Suddenly, the sound of hooves interrupted him and he straightened his back.“ Soldiers! ”, he shouted. The rows of men suddenly were well - ordered and armed. She tried to make out any faces of the opposite front, but could only see horses. As they came closer , she spotted it. A huge white shadow, running next to a black horse on which sat- him. He had grown taller and sturdier since the last time she saw him. His black curls were held back in a bun and he looked like he aged twenty years - from sorrows, she supposed. Her heart ached at the sight of him and all she wanted to do was to be held by him, finally safe. But it wasn’t over yet. She prayed to all the gods she knew that he wouldn’t do something heroic. “Snow!” Ramsay yelled across the battlefield. “I heard you wanted my toys back? Well, I’ve got them right here!” With this words he pulled her in front of him. His horse whickered nervously. He then pulled at a rope that laid over the horse’s back. Rickon stumbled over to them, his doe eyes widened and looking at her.“ Do you like games, little lord? ” Rickon didn’t move. “Go on then, run to your brother.” He pointed at the other side of the field. She inhaled sharply when he pulled out a flying knife, brought it down and - cut through the rope that held Rickons hands together. He looked at her with disbelief and started to slowly go towards the field.“ You have to turn around and run. Walking isn’t playing by the rules.."Rickon turned around and started to run. She then saw Ramsay pulling out a bow.” Run, Rickon! “, she cried out. On the other side, Jon had started to gallop towards him at a insane pace.” They’re gonna make it", Y/N muttered to herself. Ramsay watched her, clearly amused. “Oh, you think so love?” He put in his last arrow. Jon was almost there when - the arrow broke through Rickon’s back.

Y/N couldn’t feel anymore. Through her wet lashes, she saw Jon dismounting his horse, heard Ramsay’s shouts and flying arrows. The next hour was a nightmare come true. Everywhere around her, men and horses were dying, whimpering in death pain. Ramsay growled in disapproval. After some time, Y/N started to realize how the bolton soldiers started to die like flies. Apparently, fresh soldiers from the Eyrie had arrived and it looked like - Jon was winning. Ramsay turned his horse around roughly, with her still before him and rode back to Winterfell.

Y/N was forced to stand next to him when he promised his men they were safe and should just ignore the giant in front of their door. Suddenly, the wood crashed. Ramsay killed the giant almost immediately and then turned to Jon who stood next to his dead protector. “You’ve already lost one of your precious treasures, bastard, would you truly risk losing another?” With this words, he pulled her in front of him, holding a knife to her throat. She searched for Jon’s eyes and practically begged for him not to save her. But he came stomping towards them, his anger radiating off him. Although Ramsay tried to hide behind his men, he was by her in a second and pushed Ramsay in the dirt. “You won’t hurt her anymore ”, he pressed out through gritted teeth and punshed Ramsay in the face - again and again, until his face was completely bloodied. Then, Jon pushed his sword through his throat. Ramsay laughed and gurgled one last time and then-it was over. Jon turned to her, his anger still apparent. But his eyes immediately softened as she began to run towards him. He caught her by the waist as she jumped onto him and nuzzled her head into the crook of his head. He deeply inhaled her soothing and familiar scent. She started sobbing into his curls as they stood like that for what felt like eternity. Y/N was the one to pull back first. “You’re hurt”, she stated and observed the gashes on his chest. “It’s nothing, my love”, he reassured her. “Did he hurt you? ” She silently shook her head, tears in her eyes. Jon started to cry too. It was a deep, animalistic sound, full of pain and Y/N couldn’t bear it. “Rickon, I should have saved him.. All these men, dying for me..” He started to cry harder and pulled her closer. “Shh, it’s okay”, Y/N told him with a shaking voice. “It’s okay.."With her cheeks still wet, she pulled him down for a kiss. Jon immediately responded and brought his hand up behind her neck to deepen the kiss and snaked his other arm around her waist. They were alive. Gods, they were alive.

Although Ramsay tried to hide behind his men, he was by her in a second and pushed Ramsay in the dirt. “You won’t hurt her anymore ”, he pressed out through gritted teeth and punshed Ramsay in the face - again and again, until his face was completely bloodied. Then, Jon pushed his sword through his throat. Ramsay laughed and gurgled one last time and then-it was over. Jon turned to her, his anger still apparent. But his eyes immediately softened as she began to run towards him. He caught her by the waist as she jumped onto him and nuzzled her head into the crook of his head. He deeply inhaled her soothing and familiar scent. She started sobbing into his curls as they stood like that for what felt like eternity. Y/N was the one to pull back first. “You’re hurt”, she stated and observed the gashes on his chest. “It’s nothing, my love”, he reassured her. “Did he hurt you? ” She silently shook her head, tears in her eyes. Jon started to cry too. It was a deep, animalistic sound, full of pain and Y/N couldn’t bear it. “Rickon, I should have saved him.. All these men, dying for me..” He started to cry harder and pulled her closer. “Shh, it’s okay”, Y/N told him with a shaking voice. “It’s okay.."With her cheeks still wet, she pulled him down for a kiss. Jon immediately responded and brought his hand up behind her neck to deepen the kiss and snaked his other arm around her waist. They were alive. Gods, they were alive.

The reunion (Jon snow)

This was in my drafts somewhere XD

Word count: 1693

Warnings : Ramsay being Ramsay, angst and war themes

Rating : mostly fluff at the end, angst, also SPOILERS for S6

This morning seemed to be colder than usual. Y/N shivered as she filled a bucket with icy water and turned back to the castle. Winterfell looked so different than she remembered it: The majestic walls and the once splendid looking towers Bran used to climb were now darkened due to the enormous fires that were lit at all times to burn the meat of animals and men. Yes, Winterfell had indeed changed. But she tried not to think about those times often, it made her too sad. Luckily, she had been up early today. This way she escaped some of the sexually suggestive comments by the wards that were to guard the prisoners. Y/N pitied them. Living with Ramsay when he was happy was already horrific, she didn’t dare to picture him when in a bad mood. She hurried inside and brushed the snow off her boots. At least, it was a bit warmer than outside, she thought bitterly. She observed the hall carefully after pouring the water into another bucket that stood by the door. She spotted Reek on the other side of the hall and quickly went over to him. Usually he was nice to her, because he was afraid that he’d displease Ramsay if he didn’t. “G-Good morning, m'lady”, he stuttered and stopped lighting candles. Y/N gave him a reassuring smile and said :“Do you know where Rickon is?"Reek quickly shook his head, looking as nervous as ever. Y/N suppressed a sigh and nodded, turning to the nearest staircase. In her chamber, she couldn’t help but cry a bit. She went to her window and looked outside : A snow storm was rising and brought back her memories. She missed Osha. And Arya and Sansa and Bran and Robb and Jon. Especially Jon. She grew up in a village near Winterfell and worked in the bakery of her parents. Because of Sansas addiction to lemon cakes she had been in the castle quite often. That’s how she had met Jon, as well. When she first had laid her eyes on him, she had fallen for him. After a while, they started to spend more time together and something like love had developed since Jon and Y/N shared their first kiss in the stables. But he had grown more reserved and when Y/N learned that he was taking the black because of his heritage, she was furious. He was too honorable,but she would have given everything to see him again. After Robb had died and the Boltons took over Winterfell, nothing was like before. Y/N had been able to escape, earning her money by working in brothels and finally joined the duo after hearing that they were heading north. Unfortunately, they got caught and were now in the grasp of Ramsay. Y/N wasn’t allowed to leave the castle grounds and she had to be his "wife” (aka his whore). She was aware that at the tiniest mistake, he’d have her head. Sighing, she turned from the window and the swirling snowflakes and decided to try and sleep for a bit. But when she moved towards her small, hard bed, she noticed a piece of paper, lying on the matress. With shaky hands she picked it up. ‘Dearest wife, please forgive me’…? Before she could comprehend the words , a calloused hand clamped over her mouth and pulled her into complete darkness. “You don’t want to make any sound right now, trust me ”, was whispered into her ear before the world went pitch black.

When she awoke, she felt worn out and thirsty. As the memories came flooding back, so did the panic. She tried to move, but she was bound to a -horse? She couldn’t see either, because a tie on her eyes made everything a dark grey. She tried to calm herself. She wouldn’t be hurt. She thought about Jon and eventually fell asleep after a while. When she woke up again, the tie had been lifted from her eyes and she saw that she was indeed sitting on a brown horse one of a hundred horses with soldiers upon them. Nervously, her eyes flew over a great, muddy field. Then she looked to the right and her heart stopped. With a sadistic grin plastered on his lips, Ramsay watched her intensely. “My wife! ”, he exclaimed softly and with an excited spark in his eyes. “I apologize for your uncomfortable transport. Sadly, it was the only way to be sure you won’t try something.. Naughty. And you know what happens with naughty girls, don’t you?” Y/N squeezed her eyes shut as images of skinned and crippled women invaded her mind.“ I do know that you would like to escape, rather than staying here with me. That.. disappoints me, pet”, he whispered gently into her ear. She shuddered involuntarily. He leaned back. “We’ll talk about that later. Now, I’ve brought you to enjoy the show. A certain bastard of Ned Stark is coming to reclaim his father’s castle and his brother - and I wonder if he even is familiar with you?” He winked at her. He couldn’t be talking about Jon, could he? Suddenly, the sound of hooves interrupted him and he straightened his back.“ Soldiers! ”, he shouted. The rows of men suddenly were well - ordered and armed. She tried to make out any faces of the opposite front, but could only see horses. As they came closer , she spotted it. A huge white shadow, running next to a black horse on which sat- him. He had grown taller and sturdier since the last time she saw him. His black curls were held back in a bun and he looked like he aged twenty years - from sorrows, she supposed. Her heart ached at the sight of him and all she wanted to do was to be held by him, finally safe. But it wasn’t over yet. She prayed to all the gods she knew that he wouldn’t do something heroic. “Snow!” Ramsay yelled across the battlefield. “I heard you wanted my toys back? Well, I’ve got them right here!” With this words he pulled her in front of him. His horse whickered nervously. He then pulled at a rope that laid over the horse’s back. Rickon stumbled over to them, his doe eyes widened and looking at her.“ Do you like games, little lord? ” Rickon didn’t move. “Go on then, run to your brother.” He pointed at the other side of the field. She inhaled sharply when he pulled out a flying knife, brought it down and - cut through the rope that held Rickons hands together. He looked at her with disbelief and started to slowly go towards the field.“ You have to turn around and run. Walking isn’t playing by the rules.."Rickon turned around and started to run. She then saw Ramsay pulling out a bow.” Run, Rickon! “, she cried out. On the other side, Jon had started to gallop towards him at a insane pace.” They’re gonna make it", Y/N muttered to herself. Ramsay watched her, clearly amused. “Oh, you think so love?” He put in his last arrow. Jon was almost there when - the arrow broke through Rickon’s back.

Y/N couldn’t feel anymore. Through her wet lashes, she saw Jon dismounting his horse, heard Ramsay’s shouts and flying arrows. The next hour was a nightmare come true. Everywhere around her, men and horses were dying, whimpering in death pain. Ramsay growled in disapproval. After some time, Y/N started to realize how the bolton soldiers started to die like flies. Apparently, fresh soldiers from the Eyrie had arrived and it looked like - Jon was winning. Ramsay turned his horse around roughly, with her still before him and rode back to Winterfell.

Y/N was forced to stand next to him when he promised his men they were safe and should just ignore the giant in front of their door. Suddenly, the wood crashed. Ramsay killed the giant almost immediately and then turned to Jon who stood next to his dead protector. “You’ve already lost one of your precious treasures, bastard, would you truly risk losing another?” With this words, he pulled her in front of him, holding a knife to her throat. She searched for Jon’s eyes and practically begged for him not to save her. But he came stomping towards them, his anger radiating off him. Although Ramsay tried to hide behind his men, he was by her in a second and pushed Ramsay in the dirt. “You won’t hurt her anymore ”, he pressed out through gritted teeth and punshed Ramsay in the face - again and again, until his face was completely bloodied. Then, Jon pushed his sword through his throat. Ramsay laughed and gurgled one last time and then-it was over. Jon turned to her, his anger still apparent. But his eyes immediately softened as she began to run towards him. He caught her by the waist as she jumped onto him and nuzzled her head into the crook of his head. He deeply inhaled her soothing and familiar scent. She started sobbing into his curls as they stood like that for what felt like eternity. Y/N was the one to pull back first. “You’re hurt”, she stated and observed the gashes on his chest. “It’s nothing, my love”, he reassured her. “Did he hurt you? ” She silently shook her head, tears in her eyes. Jon started to cry too. It was a deep, animalistic sound, full of pain and Y/N couldn’t bear it. “Rickon, I should have saved him.. All these men, dying for me..” He started to cry harder and pulled her closer. “Shh, it’s okay”, Y/N told him with a shaking voice. “It’s okay.."With her cheeks still wet, she pulled him down for a kiss. Jon immediately responded and brought his hand up behind her neck to deepen the kiss and snaked his other arm around her waist. They were alive. Gods, they were alive.
